comment.author: 53922404@N05
comment._content:
Looking at the cars on Bronte Marine Drive I'd suggest immediately before or just after WW2 - there's a couple of late 1920s-early 30s cars, a late 30's truck and several late 30s vehicles.
Also worth noting that the 1943 Sydney aerial photos on the Lands Dept Six Viewer show the Bronte Beach precinct pretty clearly and the shelter sheds above the SLC are there in 1943 as are the vacant blocks of land on Bronte Marine Drive.
JennysOldCars

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: We have a late 1930s date for this photos thank to additional information provided on the Archives Outside blog - which also corresponds to the info above. This one was a bit tricky; thanks for your help! AB
